data.what_is:
Autopilot is now Ortto.

Ortto, the world's first complete marketing automation and analytics platform, empowers marketers to execute impressive campaigns that drive business growth. By combining three powerful tools into one platform that's supercharged with AI, teams finally benefit from their marketing automation, customer data, and analytics working together. 

Sophisticated yet easy-to-use, more than 3,000 customers trust Ortto to understand their impact, discover their next marketing opportunity, and continuously iterate to deliver great customer experiences at scale.
data.product_description: Ortto is easy and visual marketing software for automating the customer journey. Marketers use Ortto to acquire, nurture and grow leads into customers with personalized email, in-app messages, SMS, and postcards.Ortto is purpose-built for marketers, consolidating the stack without compromising on functionality.It unifies data in a customer data platform that's connected to a robust suite of marketing automation tools so teams can discover  insights, then seamlessly take action on them. It also has powerful analytics functionality with an intuitive interface so marketers can easily understand what's working (and why). Powerful AI, thoughtfully integrated into the platform, means teams can improve productivity without reinventing their processes.

initial_reviews.review_title: Clean UI, excellent service, a few glitches
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The UI is very clean and intuitive, which makes the process of campaign building very easy and natural - a real benefit in our already busy days.

The customer support is a real standout too, because on two occasions they promptly addressed our concerns over live chat in a really professional and friendly way.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
There are a couple of glitches here and there, but nothing serious.

We find that when we are testing emails some of the publishing looks 'a bit off' compared to the finished product, making it harder to feel sure about the final appearance. In saying this, some of this could be due to various email clients like Outlook365.

While the personal tech support is fantastic and better than most SaaS products we use, the self-serve articles aren't always as detailed or helpful. I've found myself a bit frustrated that I can't look up an answer and instead need to start a chat.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ortto helps us communicate to our entire audience broken up into various subsets. They are distinct audiences and Ortto makes it possible to house all the info in one place, while running various activities/campaigns simply and quickly.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great Product and Exceptional Support
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
I've been in web development and support roles for over 20 years. I've used thousands of SaaS products and services. I'm delighted with the level of pre-sale and after-sale support at Ortto.

Ortto staff patiently and intelligently answered many many pre-sale questions over a long period.

And the support after we jumped on board has been exceptional from everyone I've dealt with at Ortto who have gone above and beyond - actually taking the time to read my questions and understand what I'm asking, anticipate needs, follow-up, be pro-active and offer great advice.

They are also encourage feedback and feature requests and are open about the product roadmap.

We are only about 6 months in, so haven't fully explored all the product has to offeryet, but so far, well done on a great, easy to use product, and an exceptional support team.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
For a smaller business or NFP, it could be on the expensive side.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
As an NFP that uses Salesforce, Ortto is helping us with lead generation, retention, scale, supporter satisfaction, connection and engagement. It's enabling us to better understand our supporters and provide value to them, with messaging tailored to their specific needs and interests.

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, awesome customer support but glitchy
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The UX is really clean and platform is easy to understand and use. The workflow builder is intuitive and there are lots of options to build and customize emails to look and feel the way you want them to. The audience filters are powerful in the sense that you can combine contact and company properties together, and still get instant results - something I've not seen in more well known CRMs that I've used.

They've also got awesome customer support who are really prompt responding, though sometimes the resolutions that they give can be a bit hit and miss.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
To be honest, there's not much to dislike about Ortto except that they are expensive and glitchy. For example, there was an important campaign that we ran where the branching logic hinged on a date comparison. Contacts were supposed to go down branch A if they entered the sequence before a particular date, and branch B otherwise. It worked fine when we tested prior to launch. On the day we set it live, for some unknown reason the logic went the other way and contacts that were supposed to go down branch A went to branch B and vice-versa. We had to halt the campaign and do damage control. This was just one of multiple glitchiness that we experienced on the platform. Needless to say, we had reliability issues with Ortto after that.

I also dislike that they can't properly attribute a conversion. On many occasions, I've seen the same conversion attributed to more than one campaign. And that makes it a challenge to gauge performance of campaigns.

The other I dislike is the global send frequency cap for all contacts. Would have made more sense if we were able to override the cap for a select number of users for testing stuff. Then we wouldn't have to impact all customer and leads by removing the global cap.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a platform that could do campaigns and capture leads on our marketing website

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, awesome customer support but glitchy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The UX is really clean and platform is easy to understand and use. The workflow builder is intuitive and there are lots of options to build and customize emails to look and feel the way you want them to. The audience filters are powerful in the sense that you can combine contact and company properties together, and still get instant results - something I've not seen in more well known CRMs that I've used.

They've also got awesome customer support who are really prompt responding, though sometimes the resolutions that they give can be a bit hit and miss.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
To be honest, there's not much to dislike about Ortto except that they are expensive and glitchy. For example, there was an important campaign that we ran where the branching logic hinged on a date comparison. Contacts were supposed to go down branch A if they entered the sequence before a particular date, and branch B otherwise. It worked fine when we tested prior to launch. On the day we set it live, for some unknown reason the logic went the other way and contacts that were supposed to go down branch A went to branch B and vice-versa. We had to halt the campaign and do damage control. This was just one of multiple glitchiness that we experienced on the platform. Needless to say, we had reliability issues with Ortto after that.

I also dislike that they can't properly attribute a conversion. On many occasions, I've seen the same conversion attributed to more than one campaign. And that makes it a challenge to gauge performance of campaigns.

The other I dislike is the global send frequency cap for all contacts. Would have made more sense if we were able to override the cap for a select number of users for testing stuff. Then we wouldn't have to impact all customer and leads by removing the global cap.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a platform that could do campaigns and capture leads on our marketing website

The design is high level and balanced on all the expectations you can have from a product. Whether you are a developer, designer or sales person, you will definitely feel that things are done right on Ortto.

The API is well documented, the mail builder allows you to make meticulous designs that show your company's seriousness. In short, you can feel that all the features are seriously thought out with an active listening to their customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Not great!!
all_reviews.review_content:

What do you dislike about Ortto?
Ortto was frustrating. We were using Autopilot (same company, slightly different product) and it did its job despite looking wildly outdated and missing many key features (no preview text field in the journey email builder?!). Ortto came along as a completely separate product from Autopilot, and the team started to push us to migrate into Ortto - moving some of the functions out of Autopilot and into Ortto's interface. For a period, support lived only in Ortto so we'd have to log into two separate tools when looking to chat with a rep. The odd connections and interdependencies of the two tools were very frustrating.

It came to a point where we figured if we had to migrate to a new tool regardless, we may as well move out to a different marketing automation platform altogether.

We found the team to be difficult to work with, too. As part of the migration to Ortto they began limiting the number of seats on our account despite our plan previously having unlimited seats. They also made promises about Ortto and initial access timelines that didn't hold up. There were no proactive communications during service downtimes. If something looks off or unusually slow, we had to wait for someone on live chat to confirm. Not a company we were interested in continuing a relationship with.

What's absolutely wild about our time with Ortto/Autopilot is we actually saved money moving away from them even though we moved to a more popular marketing automation platform.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We used Ortto for marketing automation - sending automated and one-off email blasts, triggering pop-ups on the site, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: One-stop-shop for email marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The "Playbook" journeys offer an unprecedented amount of control and customization compared to our old email marketing platforms. Being able to essentially program how our content is distributed is very powerful.
The AI-powered copywriting assistant can be a good way of overcoming writer's block, and it really shines when it comes to re-writing subject lines.
The reporting and dashboard system is well designed and saves us an immense amount of time when it comes to reporting to management.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
There is no central hub for reviewing and editing existing email templates. Templates can only be saved by building out an actual email as part of a campaign. We have no option of going into an existing template, editing it, and saving the changes in the same template. We've learned to work around it, but this is still the one major UX flaw we have run into.
We use Woocommerce, and the integration is not as smooth as we had hoped. Reading the user guide, we see that Shopify is clearly the e-commerce platform with the greatest integration and support with Ortto - as Woocommerce users, this leaves something to be desired.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Make use of the 14-day trial.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to customize and personalize customer journeys to an extent that we never could do before. Instead of simple branching customer journeys we were used to in MailChimp, Ortto provides a framework for us to sequence content, control touch points, and granularize the way we distribute it. It takes some getting used to but it's immensely powerful.

all_reviews.review_title: A fantastic tool that has completely changed how we onboard our customers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
- Flow automation and tracking. The visual flow builder does exactly what it says on the box and lived up to my expectations.
- Also the support team have been very friendly and responsive. I've contacted them a couple of time... one for a new feature and another for a concept I didn't quite understand at the beginning.... but now makes all the sense in the world
- I like the HeadsUp concept, but we haven't yet implemented it. we'll be doing this shortly inside our web-app and then later on our website.

- Integration with HubSpot is great, but I'd like to see a few more actions available (also the mapping with un-subscription settings could be easier)

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use with a host of valuable integrations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
We use Autopilot for all of our marketing journeys and communications and stick with them for a number of reasons: 1) they provide access to their entire product at every price point (only increases as number of customers increase), 2) the range of 3rd party integrations available, including Twilio, Intercom, Slack, Google, Facebook and so many more and 3) customer marketing journeys are very easy to build/edit/iterate, etc. and do not require much technical know-how (beyond setting up any webhooks/APIs you may use). Additionally their email marketing product has come a long way. The email marketing product is still in Beta, but it's intuitive and effective, and it's my understanding the team is rolling out a host of new features to improve it further in the coming months.

As an additional benefit, the user on-boarding was extremely easy, and I was paired with a customer success rep at the beginning of my membership to help answer any questions I had.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
Live chat support could be quicker to respond, and some email features are still lacking (but as I understand, are being worked on).

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Sign up for the free 30-day trial, ask the team questions, watch the training videos, and you should be on your way.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation, user on-boarding, marketing email campaigns. Autopilot's "journeys" product, which allow me to visualize the entire marketing funnel for a customer, have made life much easier in terms of seeing the full marketing life-cycle for a customer. In a given journey, you can send welcome emails and notifications, add customers to lists, remove them from lists, tag them on Intercom, update your CRM, and much more, ensuring every customer receives a bespoke experience that increases retention and product engagement.

all_reviews.review_title: Great product, untrustworthy company.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The tool itself is pretty awesome and it has a lot of unique features like Segment integration and unique services like Lob to send postcards.

In terms of a nice user experience for a multi-channel marketing program, Autopilot really ticks the boxes when it comes to functionality and ease of use.

Their UI is gorgeous and intuitive.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
This review used to be a 10 out of 10, and I've referred dozens of customers to them because I LOVE their product.

But they have proven to be a completely untrustworthy company when it comes to their billing and pricing.

I have been through 2 pricing changes where they have put what were once core features like Segment integration into a higher tier and I've had grandfathered pricing disappear or not scale up when the contact count increases.

They moved some features back into all tiers and I started to recommend them because I thought the product was great value and I started to use it on my marketing automation implementation projects.

The second price increase in July 2019 effectively tripled the cost of the service for some clients. To make matters worse, the increase occurred with 6 days notice which resulted in a lot of shock and anger from my clients who I trustingly referred to the platform.

Most clients didn't even know until they looked at their credit card statements and are all now scrambling to find other solutions.

I don't fault Autopilot for raising their prices so much as the way that they have done it. In both cases it has been done in a sneaky way with little notice given to customers who have seen their bills explode with no corresponding increase in value.

I guess I figured the first price shift was done because it was an early stage startup, but it appears the culture hasn't changed sadly.

Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice. Shame on me.






Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Look at alternatives from companies that understand the importance of customer trust.

all_reviews.review_title: Untrustworthy: used to be a great product at a good price point
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
Two years ago when I first used Autopilot I really thought it was an industry game changer. I migrated everything from Mailchimp and Campaign Monitor to it, including my company and one consulting client I had. The pricing was good (although not great, almost double what I paid for Campaign Monitor) but the features made it into a no brainer for me to switch.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
A month ago I received an email from Autopilot camouflaged as "We're changing our terms", it turned out it was mostly a pricing change. The prices were TRIPLED for my account. The email made it look as if the changes would be effective immediately, fortunately it was 20 days before I received my next credit card charge. I still think it was a short notice but not as bad as I originally thought. I wrote an email to the support team and got a perplexing "we're changing our pricing because it's too confusing". I immediately tweeted publicly about the changes and later on I found that as time passed by, more and more people started replying to my tweets to the company about the pricing change. There were people who did not even receive the email because they were not subscribed to the newsletter. Some of them had grandfathered accounts and to their demise, the web pages about the grandfathered accounts were effectively deleted. When they contacted support the web pages were "magically" reinstated. All this experience has been incredibly frustrating. I would not recommend this untrustworthy company. I understand sometimes we have to increase prices or change revenue models, but the way Autopilot handled this (the CEO) was literally textbook on how to lie and stab your oldest and most loyal customers on the back. I do not have good feelings about the future of the company. The product has not been updated or had new features added for many months now, probably more than a year, at least for what I saw. I had this problem with the WYSIWYG editor on emails in which the newline character would make the spaces in my emails collapse or yield random spaces in the final sent email, it was never fixed in the two years I used Autopilot. Given the fact that the price for my account was increased from $50 USD to $150 USD I do not think that Autopilot is a good choice. For the price point I would probably use ActiveCampaign. I'm in the process of figuring out how to migrate.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Be wary of the direction that the company is taking. Given the untrustworthiness I would suggest to stay away.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Despite the flaws I found my Autopilot journeys solved a wide array of problems for my company. I had production journeys for mailing campaigns, lead magnets and facebook audiences tied to clicks in my mails. I really thought it was a fantastical product. I even wrote my own AWS Lambda function to subscribe clients to my Autopilot mailing lists using plain HTML forms, in order not to expose my API keys through Javascript. I was deeply invested in Autopilot.

all_reviews.review_title: Don't trust them
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
They integrate with a ton of other great products and getting started is very simple. You could have an email campaign up and running in 5 minutes flat.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
Let me preface this by saying that they offer a great product and it's probably worth what they're charging for it. I've been with them through two price increases but lost trust in them after the most recent increase.

Since 2015, I had received an invoice each month after they charged my card, but never got one this month. After noticing a suspicious charge on my bank statement, I reached out to their support team and realized they had updated their pricing without notifying me.

They claim I never received an email about the changes because I had unsubscribed (could be true, they were sending at least one email every day at one point), but the fact of the matter is, customers should never be able to opt-out of important, transactional emails related to their accounts (which I never intended to do).

The new pricing model is 8x more expensive than what I had been charged under my grandfathered account (a price they promised would be honored indefinitely after their first price increase), and has left me scrambling to find a new service.

Autopilot has pushed the blame on me for not knowing about the increase, and was only willing to offer me a discount for the next year of service. Thanks, but no thanks.

Can't support a company as unethical as they are.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Still a very new company. Maybe stick with one that has more experience under their belt, especially when it comes to customer relations.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's very easy to create and automate customer journeys. Whether that's a welcome email as soon as someone signs up, to mailing them a postcard through Lob when they reach a milestone, I'm confident anyone on my team could hop right in and understand it.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use and great support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
Autopilot is so much simpler than other marketing automation systems. It's very easy to create, review and keep track of the automated journeys you have going. Unlike other systems, the journeys you create are drag and drop, and it's very easy to see the different branches of a journey at a glance. Having 24 support available via Livechat has also been incredibly helpful - it's easy to ask quick questions, or get advice and support on trickier issues. The support team has helped us set up some foundational journeys to flag issues and opportunities and implement business rules around send frequency.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
As with platforms, there are limitations. The biggest limitation for us in Autopilot is the fact that they use email address as unique identifier, rather than a unique username. This has made it impossible for us to sync with our CRM, has resulted in duplicates for contacts who use one email address (there's also no merge function) and also rules out SMS communication unless we have email as well as phone number.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Think about what you actually need - there are many platforms with more bells and whistles, but they are also much more complex!

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Autopilot has helped us role out - and test - action triggered emails. To reach people when they are most likely to open, read and act on our emails, like right after they have subscribed, or taken an action on our website. The open and click rates for these emails are almost double that of our broadcast emails, even when the content is similar.

all_reviews.review_title: Effective and visual. A software that does the job of a marketing team.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
I'm a visual person so being able to set shapes out in a format that tells a story or is a journey paints a clear picture of the outcome I am trying to achieve. The user can then verify this plan via shit hot customer service chat, or submit it for a full review. There are also endless articles to refer to and they are written in plain English (no technobabble). Which means you've never left hanging. The shapes themselves inspire ideas to add more to your journey and make it more effective.
Then after all of this, it's easy to present to clients because of the visual platform.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
What do I dislike, not much if anything? Autopilot are always making improvements to the software so it's hard to pick on anything.  As an admin for many companies, I guess it would be nice to be able to enter in multiple email addresses of those who need to be made aware when an error occurs, currently these errors are only emailed to one person (for example API limitations). A future UI suggestions would be the ability to hide shapes that are not relevant (ie other CRMs). A magical wishlist item would be taking testing easier. For example, if you have a 30-day journey to be able to push a 'test' button and it sends all emails/SMS etc over an hour instead of a month showing if there are any errors in your plan.
** But you'll note that none of these things are interfering with everyday use - the system is smooth, fast and easy to use.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Try it for one journey and you won't want to stop.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problem being solved: Marketing journeys for small businesses in a growth phase.  Companies who don't have the funds to hire a marketing team but it is integral they have marketing and the automations that make the marketing transparent and actionable.
The benefits are watching the communication with customers increase which in turn increases the bottom line. Isn't that the benefit we all want to achieve?

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
This is a good choice for early stage startups that are scaling quickly.
- great customer support via chat
- love the colorful drag and drop shapes
- quickly and easily build complex journeys

Also, we have to pay extra for a dedicated IP because deliverablilty/inbox placement wasn't very good - we tested against a number of other email marketing tools and AP was, by far, the worst performer. Since this is an email marketing tool, I'm not fond of paying extra to ensure good deliverability.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
FIrst and foremost, I am in love with how easy-to-use and intuitive Autopilot's interface is. Creating our customer journeys drap-and-drop style really works for me and provides me with a great visual.

When I was a new user last year, I consulted with their customer support team frequently, and they've always been nothing but friendly, patient, and crystal clear when assisting me with any questions I threw their way. So, major shoutout to their exceptional support team!

Finally, Autopilot fits nicely in our budget and makes marketing automation possible for us.

The Pipedrive integration has a few kinks to work out. The fields in Pipedrive don't pull over into Autopilot correctly for us, but is a known issue for their development team that they're continuing to fix.

Implementing journeys through Autopilot has allowed us to nurture our leads and clients on a deeper level and has lessened the burden on our product team, as they were doing everything manually prior to AP.

all_reviews.review_title: Best of breed for marketing automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
By far, the biggest advantage is their customer support. They're highly knowledgeable. Always helpful. And, have always been available to help me with VERY tricky questions and scenarios, during normal business hours.

Journeys are really intuitive to design with the drag and drop editor.

Sophisticated omni-channel campaigns are a breeze to build, with email marketing, facebook and google ads audiences, twilio, direct mail... and you can take things even further with a tool called Segment.

The number of native integrations available are amazing. Yes, you can use Zapier and webhooks - their API is intuitive and easy to use. But, what I'm talking about is the number of *native* integrations, that share data back and forth, with Autopilot, because a centralised view of your customers behaviour, is what you're trying to achieve.

They already integrate, natively, with some of the most popular CRMs, including Salesforce and Pipedrive.  (I saw on their roadmap that the free Hubspot CRM integration is in the works.)

What do you dislike about Ortto?
There's two things I believe are lacking and need to be addressed, to be an automatic YES, for anyone considering Autopilot:

Tagging - this is currently not possible. Their answer is Smart Segments - handy, but doesn't quite cover some of the scenarios where you need to be able to tag your prospects.

Forms - they have an amazing tool for integrating with just about any form you can point at. However, in some cases this feature fails. My suggestion to Autopilot, is to create a very basic form that developers can trigger. Nothing fancy is required.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Add tag management

Add basic form

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm looking for a system that can act as the backbone of my marketing operation.

Besides obvious features, such as email marketing, customer database, contact management etc, key features I need, include:
* Centralised view of prospect behaviour
* Intergration capabilities
* omnichannel marketing campaigns
* easy to use API for custom connections

I think Autopilot does an amazing job, and for such a slack application, it's one of the lowest cost solutions available.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Automation Product at a Terrific Price Point for Introductory Users
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The journey-builder is the definite highlight of Autopilot for us. Journeys are easy and intuitive to build, but have a large list of options for both triggers, conditions, and actions. Lead-tracking, analytics and email studio are all great features, but the journey-builder is the real highlight. The API is easy to use and has allowed us to integrate with our WordPress website, Twilio account and Salesforce CRM. The documentation is plentiful and helpful, as well. Finally, Autopilot is an exceptional value at the introductory price point. In our research, we were unable to find anything else with nearly the functionality for the price.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
Some elements, including smart segments, are tricky to use and criteria cannot be edited after deploying or saving. This can easily lead to a glut of similar smart segments which clutters the interface and folders. Some elements of journeys similarly, are difficult to edit after publishing.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
For entry-level marketing automation, Autopilot is a terrific option. If you're looking for a CRM-type product with automation, you may want to look elsewhere.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Autopilot has given us far greater abilities to automate basic communication with prospects across a variety of channels. Previously, we were obliged to cobble together different solutions for email blasts, 1-to-1 emails, SMS, and postcards. Autopilot allows us to integrate all of these channels into a single journey, and to further integrate that journey with actions on our website.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
Autopilot is a phenomenal tool for marketing automation and email workflows! It connects almost seamlessly with the tools I use every day which is essential for keeping our team in the know and on the same page.

Other things I like about Autopilot are:
-It has a ton of integrations with other tools
-Workflows are really easy to build and are visually appealing. You can also connect something to an existing path rather than building out the same flow in a different branch (something I had to do with HubSpot which was a big waste of time)
-You can set "goals" on your journeys which are super customizable to your company's needs because you can use lists and segments. This is so much more powerful because you can move beyond just email click and open rates

What do you dislike about Ortto?
I would really like for Autopilot to develop native forms. The theme on our website has a variety of forms and pop-ups (the Divi theme with the Bloom plugin, which is a very popular Wordpress theme) but they won't work with Autopilot because it requires me to connect directly with an email provider and Autopilot is not one of them. Typically I could select the option to paste an HTML form, but since this isn't something Autopilot has, I don't have a way of connecting them.

The problem I now have is that I'm using a form plugin (Ninja Forms) but this can't be read by Autopilot's form reader. The submit buttons aren't actually coded in the right way for Autopilot to recognize them, so I've had to use Zapier to connect these tools. I have my workflow down and this works, but it's a bunch of extra steps for a simple task and it makes it difficult for my team to jump in and help because there are so many programs to coordinate.

There are form plugins that will work, but I have other criteria I need to consider and Ninja Forms was the best option. It was easier for me to just use Zapier and have my other criteria met by the form than using a plugin that connects well with Autopilot.

The other things I wish Autopilot did better or had solutions for are:
-Reporting beyond just emails
-Ability to customize the fields I see on contact views
-A section for emails so I didn't have to go through journeys themselves
-In the email reporting section, I would really like to be able to see the actual contacts in each bucket (opened, clicked, replied, etc) without having to export them or create a list
-I wish there was a way to have general journey enrollment criteria without having to create segments or lists (similar to how HubSpot is setup). I want to keep my segments and lists clean, and sometimes I need to create a really specific segment for a journey to run. It just makes for unnecessary clutter
-I wish it was easier to schedule an email at a specific time. It's a bit of a weird process because you can set your jounry live and "delay" the email by a certain time but it's a bit odd. It's because the tool is moreso meant for a series of emails rather than one-offs

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
If you want something that allows for super customizable marketing automation and email workflows, this is a great option! If you're looking for a more all-in-one tool, you will likely feel like Autopilot is missing some things. If you're resourceful and have a knack for tech, Autopilot is a ton of fun to work with.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ensuring our marketing tool connects with our CRM so that we don't have data silos, and our team can see the full scope of the customer journey/engagements.

The main things I use Autopilot for is general marketing automation. This allows me to automatically update data based on a variety of criteria, seamlessly send leads to Salesforce, update our team via Slack and email about new opt-ins, and so on.

The other, more important thing I use Autopilot for is email workflows. We have a custom integration built with Salesforce where we pipe data in from our SaaS tool. This connects with Autopilot which allows me to send segmented emails to our customers and prospects with content tailored to them depending on how they use our product. This is fantastic because it makes our email marketing so much more relevant.

all_reviews.review_title: Great value for a great marketing automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
Setting up customer journeys is easier in Autopilot than in any of the other marketing automation platforms that I have used. Add that to the fact that there are so many integrations, as well as the ability to use Zapier, and you have a really solid platform here that keeps getting better. I love the ability to add different types of customer touch-points such as text messaging and even post cards.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
I think that the biggest thing missing for me in Autopliot is the ability to build my own forms and use them on my landing pages and website. There are a couple of integrations for landing page builders (unfortunately not the one I use) but it is a bit time consuming to get certain fields hidden/working correctly. Another small thing is that I would love to be able to zoom out a little further in the "journey" view to get more of an overall view, especially when I am presenting to my clients.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Check to make sure all of the current software in your current marketing stack is in the integrations for Autopilot or that there is a way to connect via Zapier. You will not be disappointed.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are moving over from a different marketing automation platform to Autopilot and so far the transition is going pretty smoothly. Building out journeys at times can be a never ending process but the options are almost limitless.

Actually we suplement the functionality of Hubspot with Autopilot because of the cost advantage of doing so.

all_reviews.review_title: I've used this product for over two years and I can highly recomend it.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
Autoilothq is really great on the support side and the product keeps improving. Its a great alternative to Intercom and are a real player in the space. It definitely wins in the ease of use category and the heads up features are one of the main reason to get a hold of this product. The integrations keep getting added all the time. Many of the rules and automation are really versatile so I have not yet found a situation where I cannot do what I want.
I like the fact they keep improving the reporting.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
It is not really an email marketing software in the traditional sense but that is not a bad thing its just a different way of working compared to a MailChimp, active campaign etc. You need to be prepared to work with that. A trial of the software will let you see if it will suit you. Support didn't have live chat at the start but now they have implemented that support really is first class.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Check out the demo or make sure it has the features you want.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keeping in touch with our customers.
Reports highlighting what marketing efforts are working.
Being able to go back to old campaigns and reuse parts that worked according to the reporting.

all_reviews.review_title: Backbone of automated nurturing system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The visual interface helps the whoel team grasp the logic of automation.  We are able to see things in a way that isn't possible in other systems. I also like that we can work on live journeys and pubish changes.. Some tools don't allow you to do that and you have duplicate the automation to edit it.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
# 1. Content snippets

I know AP is working on this - so the biggest missing feature won't be missing for too much longer: Content Snippets.

This is where you can write a piece of content - say a call to action - and save it to be used everwhere. So rather than writing a CTA html button for each of your emails (or pasting them from your initial one), you can write it in one place and then simply insert a placeholder for it in your emails, e.g. {{ custom.cta_button }}.  This allows you to edit it in one place and see changes everywhere.

AP are working on this setup using liquid syntax - this is a feature I am really looking forward to just for the straight content snippet functionality, however I've also learned that they are going to implement control flow tags too - this is where you can dynamically change the content outputed in the placeholder if the record (e.g. person you're emailing) meets certain logical criteria.  This will be an exceptionally powerful addition.

#2. Partial pipedrice syncing
Not quite sure what to 'name' this issue. But pipedrive is where we keep ALL customer data (current, old) as well as partner data (we have 4 pipelines).  But we do not want to interact with all of these people through AP, we just want one certain pipeline to be pulled into AP. However we have no option but to sync the whole CRM database.  This causes some pain because the pricing plan you are on is dictated by the number of contacts.  I would like to see AP build some additional logic into their integratrion with CRMs whereby only certain contacts from within the CRM are pulled into AP.


Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
It may seem overwhelming when you see the array of options in the canvas design editor... but once you've built one journey, you will have the logic down and you'll be on your way to automation mastery!


What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Preventing drop offs in our marketing and sales funnels.
We leverage our marketing resource 10:1. One marketer + Autopilot = 10 Marketers working manually on follow ups

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing automation outreach tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
Very nice tool for outreach. Several paths to create. Intuitive and support is helpful and replies quickly. Set A B Testing is very easy, and they have a clear view for analytics. You can choose from a large list of triggers and then create a personalized flow for your leads

What do you dislike about Ortto?
a lot of features, and maybe not enough tutorials. It lacks some integrations for example voicemails. And the only tool integrated for text messages is Twilio that I don't use. It would have been easier if we could choose our own integrations from a list or have possibilities to choose within Zapier. The dashboard view can be improved in terms of user interface, and it doesn't refresh automatically.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Try it, you can have a demo and the person I got on the phone explains very well. In a few dozens of minutes I had my first journey running with interesting and encouraging results. There are plenty of possibilities, you can add Text Messages, typeforms, and create personalized flows with personalized emails. Possibility to use merge tags.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
I can automate outreach campaigns and let leads come back easily. I save a lot of time, and I can handle way more campaigns at the same time. Slack integrations helps me flag all the good news, and I can therefore take actions quickly. I'm not using the web tracking code for the moment. But I'll definitely do it in the future.

The fact that you are able to experiment with different journeys and we are able to have our work reviewed and corrected on a live basis is tremendously helpful. The idea of Autopilot making our systems automated is what we have been trying to implement through other different apps before and it hasnt worked as amazingly as this, Autopilot was an easy set up into easy-to-understand system just by watching a few videos which also takes away from trying to learn a complex system with a friendly User Interface.

all_reviews.review_title: Autopilot Marketing Automation Made Easy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The user-friendly visual canvas design allows is intuitive enough to use for experienced and non-experienced marketers alike. The ability to design overlapping journeys without using code is one of the strongest features as is the ability to see at a glance the full marketing funnel from sign-up to conversion.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
The menu navigation is very narrow. Making column width extendable would allow for much faster and easier navigation. Giving customers the ability to create more custom logic when comparing fields such as adding dynamic date fields would make the platform more powerful as would improving the analytics and reporting capability which is currently very basic, and not highly customisable.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Staff are very helpful online.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using Autopilot to manage direct marketing online lead generation right through to sales conversion. Doing so has allowed us to increase conversion rates and improve customer satisfaction throughout the entire journey. A key measure of success for us has been scalability. Autopilot has been critical to our success in managing high volumes of new leads.

all_reviews.review_content:

Ultimately, you feel you have future proofed your business with AutoPilot and its capabilities seem limitless. It truly is an incredible product and the support is second to none. Could not recommend it highly enough

What do you dislike about Ortto?
Nothing at all. There is a steep learning curve, but if you make use of the amazing support abs take it one step at a time, you'll be great!

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a lot of segmentation for our contacts. We had been with Convertkit who kept promising more segmentation, but it never materialised. With Autopilot, you only seemed to be limited by your own imagination! We've still got a lot to learn, but have been incredibly impressed so far

all_reviews.review_title: Really Awesome Platform, Still Some Room to Grow
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The Journeys builder is certainly the reason to purchase AutoPilot. It's very intuitive and to say that it's robust or flexible doesn't really do the description justice.

Especially if you are also using a CRM product like SalesForce - or in my case, PipeDrive - the integration is seamless and as reliable as if it were the same platform. In fact, there are some things that I can't accomplish with PipeDrive that I was able to do with AutoPilot integration.

Lastly, their chat support is pretty awesome. I've had probably three times where I couldn't figure out what I needed and checked in with their online support. All three times the support people were thorough and obviously knowledgeable.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
There are a few minor things I'd expect that are not available. The most blaring is that you cannot send on-demand emails. Everything must be pushed through a contact Journey. We do a lot of non-regular events and content that require on-demand email blasts, which are now a lot more complicated.

Also, the report and analytics section is just really underdeveloped. As is the main dashboard that shows contact interactions. I assume this is just a product of the platform still being young and the R&D being focused on the Journeys - which again, is the reason to buy the platform.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We recently moved to a new CRM leaving us without an email automation tool. We are a heavy content marketing firm and email automation with social and website integrations is really important.

As a pilot, we just released a limited time service offering that lives on the website. With AutoPilot we are able to monitor our signup form (without any custom code whatsoever) and pop messages that look like live chats (also without code) to help generate leads for people who visit the page .. and likely pushed there by emails also from AutoPilot. So far, we've generated a couple leads in a few days and these are automatically pushed into PipeDrive for our sales team.

all_reviews.review_title: *The* platform for SaaS businesses to automate their marketing!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
As a software based business, the ability to create automated, dynamic marketing experiences for our customers is critical - enabling us to provide a personalised, yet consistent experience for our customers was something that a lot of solutions failed to allow us to achieve. This is a user friendly, and continually developing platform that will enable your business to create effective and process-driven marketing workflows for your business.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
The key problem was consistent, yet personalized marketing for our customers. Using Autopilot has enabled us to implement customer on-boarding & dunning processes that optimize those parts of our business by addressing key actions / questions our customers may have. This has helped us to increase customer satisfaction and improve retention. We look forward to exploring this further, as we venture into integration points such as Delicious to measure customer satisfaction.

all_reviews.review_title: Remarketing and Marketing Automation with AutoPilot
all_reviews.review_content:

The ability to define overlapping and interacting journeys without using code is amazing. Without AutoPilot I'd likely have to hire two additional full-time employees to handle communication with clients as they move from pre-sign up through the client life cycle. With AutoPilot statuses are pushed across from my CRM automatically (through Zapier) triggering the correct "journeys" (sets of emails based around the current state in the customer life cycle.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
My only criticism of AutoPilot is that their analytics should have more depth and be more customizable. It's definitely possible to create and also extract useful data from the pre-determined views. But creating powerful custom reports doesn't seem to be a current function.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Make full use of the templates provided to get an idea of how to build you own solutions and lean on the support team and live chat early on, they're amazingly helpful.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
AutoPilot manages the remarketing emails for pre-sign ups and also the movement of Upstream's customers through our entire process. We've increased customer satisfaction, and clearness of expectations while adding no staff overhead to do so.

Knowing the best and quickest way to set up a journey to achieve a goal - as there are many options to choose from, sometimes it can be overwhelming, especially if you're new to the product and still need to learn it. Sometimes you end up just "sticking with what you know", and therefore lose the potential and capability the product was designed for. It's great but sometimes feels like a beast you need to tame - and understanding will only come with time and the more often you're in and use the product.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
I think because we are dealing with some legacy issues and still figuring out how best to achieve our business outcomes and goals using AutoPilot (driving brand awareness and converting potential leads into supporters of our organisation) and also best practice and using the product the way it was intended (for personalised comms journeys, not just email blast outs), we are still to fully realise the benefits.

all_reviews.review_title: Budget Marketing Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
Very intuitive to use which makes creating journeys a breeze. Has native support for a bunch of software solutions out there such as Twilio and Salesforce. Pricing is fair for the features that they offer.

API documentation is very good which makes it easy to integrate Autopilot into pretty much anything.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
The backend of Autopilot is incredibly slow. Simple tasks such as moving a contact to a specific list within a journey can take several minutes at a time to run. This ends up being causing a lot of frustration when you're testing out a journey and you're just sitting there waiting for a contact to move through the journey steps.

The webhook support is very weak. You can only subscribe to a predetermined list of webhooks available so if you need any functionality outside of that, you'll have to use workarounds. It would be nice to have webhook blocks in the journey creation. Allowing you to send a custom webhook with custom data in a journey would make it much much easier to integrate with other applications.

When creating journeys, you cannot keep zooming out indefinitely, as a result, if you have a large journey, it will be impossible to connect a block on the left side to a block on the far right since you can't view them in the same view.


Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Try it out and see for yourself. If you need something simple then Autopilot should suffice. If you are looking for more advanced features for automation you may need to look elsewhere.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Trying to automate the inbound lead flow for our client managers. The benefit realized is the ability to send targeted emails to our leads.

all_reviews.review_title: Great solution/company that fits our needs perfectly
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
When searching for the right marketing automation solution for our company, we had a few criteria that were hard to find all-in-one. A solution that worked best for our backend environment (mostly events coming from Segment that would feed nicely into the solution), a solution that was affordable but not cheap as we have offer 100K contacts currently and this increasing by at least 6K per month, a solution that was user-friendly and visually nice to use, and a solution that had a team behind it that we could trust (fast-moving, responsive, and fun). Autopilot checked all of these boxes plus more. I really appreciate how flexible the tool is and how it can play pretty nicely with most other software we use via direct integration and/or Zapier. I foresee us being with Autopilot for the long-haul and I'm happy about that!

What do you dislike about Ortto?
The only thing I don't love about Autopilot is the dashboard. It only works if you use Salesforce and we don't so it provides no value for us.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Do your research. There's not one tool that's perfect for everyone. But if Autopilot fits your needs, I'd say they're the ones to go with :)

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before Autopilot, we did not have someone that would be managing the solution full-time, so we were using ActiveCampaign. I then came on full-time and ActiveCampaign just had so many backend issues that we had to deal with for months. Soon after starting and taking on all of these issues we were having with AC, I realized it was already time to look for a replacement. I did EXTENSIVE research on 11 tools -- demos, weeks of testing, and Autopilot came out on top by a ten-fold. We are now able to market to the massive amount of contacts we have and from that we see on average 1K more contacts testing our software each month than we did before.

all_reviews.review_title: Great product - but we quickly outgrow it
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
This is a great product for its price. Definitely punching above its weight in that regard. Love the visual drag-and-drop builder for automated journeys. Very easy to learn and get up and running. Support is top-notch - support team is quick to respond and knowledgeable.

The headsup tools was easy to setup as well, and works really well within an automated journey.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
AutoPilot is missing features, large and small, that other more established providers offer as standard. Many little things started to annoy me, but I'll outline the my major concerns.

The email builder is very limited. Not drag and drop, and restricting in terms of layout and structure. Although they mentioned an upgrade is coming.

The reports are also limited - info is slow to load, and does not offer many metrics. It is outsourced to a 3rd party supplier and the experience of pulling data and scheduling reports is clunky and not very informative.

AB testing is only available in the premium pricing tier.

Also found that segmentation options were not as detailed as we required in order to personalise and automate as much as we wanted.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
This is a great company, and if you're starting out with automation then it is the perfect option. Give them another 1-2 years and they'll be real heavy hitters.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automated onboarding comms journeys.
Lead nurturing
Event related comms.
Fundraising support
Zapier integration also allows for automated documentation processes.

all_reviews.review_title: High functioning features paired with visually pleasant interface.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
As someone who was new with email marketing it was really easy to set up my first automation. Everything is straightforward and based on how the user interacts with the emails I can easily set up segments of customers. A/B  spilt testing is also very easy to set up, which is very important in my role. I also like how it tracks and records customer interactions with the site. This has helped me build better segments and understand what people are doing before converting.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
The HTML builder is not as good as other email platforms. I've found myself making HTML templates on other platforms then uploading them into Autopilot. The reporting could be improved, especially when I try to compare results from spilt tests.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Use the free trial and copy one of your campaigns over to Autopilot. That way you can see if it is easier than your current system and see if their are additional features you could leverage.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Once they are in the nurture campaign I can track their movements and actions on our site. This has been extremely helpful in finding out key triggers that make people convert. It also helped determine what kind of content people are responding to.

Another benefit is the lead score. Using the key actions that I have learned from the tracking, I can assign a score to every action some one takes. Then using that score I can move them into a special journey that is optimized for people who are more ready to convert. The opposite of that if someone is taking longer than normal i can transfer them to a journey with more content.

all_reviews.review_content:

Autopilot has easy functionality for building email campaigns which they call "Journeys". It is also easy to upload contacts and to create smart segments.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
One major downside to Autopilot is that you cannot track replies to emails. You also cannot open multiple tabs within autopilot. There is no right click functionality on anything. As a result, you have to open a whole new web tab and login to use multiple tabs at a time. Additionally, you are not able to modify the width of columns in their interface. Every column of information is exactly the same width. This often results in not being able to see the full title of a Journey.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
I think this is a good tool if you have a limited budget and limited use case for an email marketing tool. If you are looking for something that fully integrates with your Salesforce instance and has a lot of extra features, this is not for you.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using Autopilot to create outbound emails to a large potential customer base. It has allowed us to connect with a higher volume of leads than we would have been able to do sending emails on an individual basis.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing deliverability; Essential for Salesforce users; Steep price for basic email campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The breadth of integrations and capabilities of Autopilot is pretty amazing. It sparks the imagination and can manage a very wide array of campaigns. Specifically for Salesforce users, it's one of the best tools I've used, and I was a very early adopter of Pardot, Marketing Cloud, and many other suites. Their deliverability is very strong as well, for those who are doing high volumes.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
It's expensive IF you just care about email campaigns. Autopilot is a marketing automation product, and a novel one at that. If you are just trying to send an email to lists, you are killing a fly with a bazooka. I would have rated a 10, but I docked 1 point for price. The other point is for a very clunky email design interface. Best practice in Autopilot is, unfortunately, to use outside template builders, and import your HTML. If the other functionality wasn't so strong, I might have gone 2 points off for this one.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are heavy Autopilot users. As a B2B2C company, we use a (fairly) sophisticated drip strategy for customer awareness and mid-stage pipe nurture. We also leverage Autopilot to campaign on behalf of client-sites to onboard end-users (250,000+ email sends monthly).

all_reviews.review_title: It's an awesome tool and great for email marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The single best feature is the visual journey editor (like a flow chart) - nowadays, I'd never use an email marketing tool that doesn't have this feature. It's great to be able to map out the whole flow of a journey in very much the same way I do on a whiteboard or in a notebook. There's also loads of options for the journey whether it be emails, slack notifications, API triggers, any kind of decision point you could want (incl which pages they've visited on your website), scoring (both lead and anything else you want), field checking and editing... it's great.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
Managing emails isn't the easiest thing in the world and there's no ability for dynamic content insertion behind traditional short merge fields (unlike Drop.co) but otherwise, it's pretty powerful.

It's quite a pain to send a one-time email but I think that's okay because it nudges you towards planning everything in advance.

Not the best native solutions for UTM tracking, definitely something worth thinking about at the time of setup (you'll want to build out a custom journey that captures and stores the data for you).

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
It's a great tool. The journey analytics/goals are a killer feature - it saved me from jumping ship.

I'd consider evaluating Drip as well (it wasn't as fully featured as it is now when I switched to Autopilot).

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
All our marketing emails are handled by Autopilot, everything from lead magnet delivery to product launches, to lead nurturing, to onboarding for our SaaS product.

all_reviews.review_title: Great simplified marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
I like how easy the automation builder is to use. Their guides and presets are an excellent way to get into marketing automation as well. I think and organize sales processes visually. If you're able to work in flow charts or like sketching out customer journeys, then this will be a great product for you. I was able to jump right in to creating automation campaigns.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
Not as robust as some of the other more specialized tools such as Pardot. My partner who is a digital marketing expert is not a big fan of Autopilot because it is too simplified for her tastes.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
If you're interested in getting marketing automation for your company for the first time, then you should strongly consider Autopilot for your needs. It's an excellent, simple tool that will help you break into the concepts of automation in a sleek package. Definitely user friendly, Autopilot is useful for power users and the less technically inclined.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are creating transactional emails and follow up drip campaigns. The greatest benefit that I have seen is how the system allows pretty much anyone to pick it up quickly and use it. We don't have to wait for a specialist to spend time to navigate the system - the rest of the team can use it.

all_reviews.review_title: Autopilot's High Flying Performance
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
I can't say enough great things about the visual interface. Personally I am a visual learner and this program immediately caught my eye. The different trigger colors and shapes help the user to mentally organize what can definitely become a complicated build. I also am a big fan of the tracking feature. A lead can be tracked as they navigate the company's website and landing page exit points which provides great behavioral data.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
When I had previously implemented the Proactive Headsup popup on our website I was using it along side another chat feature on the right hand side of the page. Autopilot's Proactive Headsup feature also showed up on the right side and I inquired if there was a way to move it to the left side so I could capitalize on both chat/questionnaire features. It seemed like a pretty simple ask and build but unfortunately couldn't be performed for me so I had to choose not to use the Proactive Headsup feature.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating awareness for our brand and products. We provide service for a product that many people aren't sure exists (pull out shelving) and can help organize their kitchen space while increasing space and accessibility. We use Autopilots' email automation to nurture leads captured through our ebook landing pages into a sale. We've realized the benefits of data collected around these 'awareness' users and have had some results with people searching for general product terminology eventually becoming design appointments and sales.

all_reviews.review_title: Very customizable marketing automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
You can track and measure every action happening on your website or product, and use it to create highly personalized and practically limitless marketing automation flows.
It brings together everything from form tracking, custom lead scoring, CRM, email marketing automation and lead nurturing. The heads-up popups are also a plus.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
The UI could have been more friendly. It feels like some elements (like the email or notifications templates) are hidden on purpose from the user. I'd like to be able to edit them without having to enter a journey.
Also, it lacks the ability to "BCC" someone on the outgoing emails (which could be used for things like CRM syncing).

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Experiment with lists. They are much more useful and flexible than you might think at first.
Also, verify your domain so you can send all emails as "name@company.com" instead of nameofcompany@autopilothq.com". This allows you to track email opens and replies as well.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation that covers every aspect of the customer journey. From the moment a potential lead visits the website, till the time they start using your app.
Form tracking without extra code or implementation is great!
In the process of setting Autopilot up, I realized that 1) their customer care team is awesome, 2) there aren't that many tools out there that can do what Autopilot does.

all_reviews.review_title: The best marketing automation tool on the market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
It's built for everyone, not just developers or tech experts. It's intuitive and great fun to use. The capabilities are awesome and constantly growing, whether you're looking to score leads, send automated (and trigger-based) emails, send an SMS message or even alert a team member about a key issue or contact. The integrations are really good and growing. The integration with Salesforce is fantastic and the tool can be used process leads before they go into Salesforce. There are some really interesting things that you can do with Intercom and journeys can be as simple or as complex as you need. We're able to build custom journeys on the fly and test new campaigns very quickly, without any need for external help. A/B testing is really great within the tool too; you can test different routes depending on actions that leads take and you can a/b test individual messages and actions, which is great when you want to segment your audience.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
The pricing is great with low numbers of contacts but quickly shoots up over the 10 and 20k mark. As soon as you go over the threshold you're charged $hundreds more each month.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
Give it a try and see how easy it is to use and implement. Getting up and running is quick.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
All aspects of marketing automation with little effort and quick results. Routing and scoring leads is also great based on their actions.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to Implement Marketing Automation That's Great for SMB's
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
Autopilot is as effective as it's user. Build marketing automation processes with easy to understand drag-and-drop functionality and you can be up and running quickly. The user does need to come up with the logic behind the process triggers and how contacts are entered into smart lists, but learning how to use Autopilot will not hinder a marketer from getting a campaign done. Autopilot also offers templates for your journeys so you can see what a recommended process may look like and customize from there (journeys are Autopilot terminology for marketing automation campaigns). Installing code was really simple and there are third party integrations available through Autopilot with select vendors like Salesforce, or by using Zapier.

I really have enjoyed working on the Autopilot platform. It's inexpensive considering the functionality you can utilize and compared to other competitors. The only suggestion I can make to Autopilot is to have a quicker method of supporting users as I have been pressed for time and have waited up to 2 days for a response via email.

The user/marketer should come up with a good strategy to keep in touch with their prospects using the technology provided by Autopilot. Autopilot gives you the capabilities through technology, but it's up to you to create a campaign that is persuasive and effective in reaching prospects.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
By using Autopilot, I am nurturing prospects continuously through behavior-trigger emails. I sort prospects based on their interest in the services my clients have to offer. I can also track my marketing funnel and the success of my offers through the analytics provided on Autopilot.

all_reviews.review_title: The best automated email marketing I've ever used.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The way you build "journeys," or the funnel a user goes through, is extremely simple to use and understand. I'm a gym owner, not a highly sophisticated email marketer. I just love the ease of use setting up a new journey and the statistics it gives you for which pages people visit on your site and the interactive stuff you can do with them based on certain criteria.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
I wish there were an easier way to send out newsletters, honestly. I'd like to have one journey for Newsletters and then each month, just plug in my updated content and re-send. Instead, you have to duplicate last month's journey and send it all over again. If I send out a weekly newsletter, then I'm going to have 52 separate journeys built at the end of the year.

Recommendations to others considering Ortto:
The other thing I really love about autopilot that I use on one of my sites is their HeadsUp. That's the little thing that pops up in the bottom corner of the screen that has my face on it and says, "Hi, I'm the owner, can I help you with anything?" or whatever you want it to say. It makes the experience much more personalized for the end users. I've gotten some good leads from it.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
The biggest problem I'm solving personally is responding to requests for more information. I used to reply to each person manually with a page and a half email describing exactly what it is I do, how I do it, how much it costs, etc. Now I've got a form on my site that asks their name, email and what they'd like more information on. Depending on what they select on that last option, a personalized, automated email gets sent to them describing how I can help them without me having to lift a finger.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Product for non-technical marketers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
I love the graphical interface that makes it easy to assemble marketing automation campaigns.  Their initial license provide for multiples users so that your small team can all use the same tool and learn together.

Autopilot is the only marketing automation tool that I've found that is truly Omni-channel in its nature.  Most can  only use email as the primary communication method.  Autopilot has SMS and Slack integration (and hopefully soon Whatsapp and Wechat!) and good old fashioned Postcards.

I started with a free trial and got to use the full functionality (others didn't have either a free trial or full functionality) right away.  As our needs grew, it was easy to upgrade and we've done so and will continue to do so in the near term.

AutoPilot works with our Professional edition of Salesforce CRM, other systems required us to spend additional funds on Enterprise Salesforce CRM to have the integrate properly.  While the Salesforce integration and syncing is limited in scope it meets all of our needs today.

Customer Services has been great.  Their success team has provided us with both phone meetings to review live and proposed programs as well as written feedback.


What do you dislike about Ortto?
I wish there was more description as to what each functional shape means so that while I'm building a new automation campaign, I can better understand if it will work for me while I'm building the plan.

While the interface is easy, some of the more advanced features are harder to implement.  We've been trying to build the head-up code into several pages on our site and it's take much longer than expected.

There is no "lead scoring" methodology in AutoPilot, so you'll have to decide when you're going to be pushing leads to your Sales Development team instead of letting the score determine such.


What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were seeking an inexpensive and scalable marketing automation tool that would integrate with our Salesforce CRM and other systems in the future.

We were seeking an Omni-channel automation tool that would grow with us.

Use Flight School! While the videos can be long, they are extremely valuable in understanding how certain things work and why you would use them.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Autopilot allows our business of 2 people to respond and treat +1000 clients as if we had a staff that was much larger.  We can personally reach out to each person on a timed basis after their purchase to share information as well as gain feedback.  This has been extremely effective in gaining positive reviews and very helpful in understanding a few shortcomings on our end.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Software but
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ortto?
The Salesforce integration is great. They've done a good job of allowing you to interact with your customer data in Salesforce seamlessly.  The addition of text and hard mail capabilities provides a nice alternative to only email marketing. They have a great user interface that makes it easy for staff to learn quickly.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
The form capture component. I think both hubspot and Infusionsoft have better capabilities here. While Autopilot has the ability to capture form data, your form must already exist on the page. It's not as simple as just having the HTML up, you must build out the functionality so the form posts someplace. Once that is completed you can then have Autopilot capture the data. This tends to be an extra step. Most other email automation software provides the ability to embed a working form into your site the captures and posts the data back to the email automation software.

Second, the pricing. They use to have a fantastic pricing model. However they chose to get rid of that in favor I higher prices without additional features. It would have been nice for them to grandfather old clients, which they claim to have offered. However that wasn't really the case. The minute your email exceed the current level they shut your account down and force you to upgrade, at which point you have to accept their newer price tiers. I could understand being asked to upgrade if they rolled out new features that you wanted to utilize. However to force upgrade past user is a little disingenuous. It's an email automation software, your list will grow, they know his and it's there way of making you feel PC while still forcing everyone to upgrade.

What problems is Ortto solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation marketing to our Salesforce database without Pardot.

What do you dislike about Ortto?
The latency of the cloud production environment can be slow. Really slow. Depending on the day, it can be frustrating to build and publish pages. Often times, there are restarts/refreshes for no apparent reason.

We are developing agile marketing funnels, and the ease of use of the the CMS and marketing automation is really easy to learn and navigate.
